cont.entity_a: Feels cheaper and clunky compared to other Logitech products.
cont.entity_b: Slim design resembles a laptop keyboard.
Occasional key recognition issues on the keyboard.

cont.entity_a: Wireless feature is appreciated. Wireless base acts as a charger for the mouse. Wireless connections work flawlessly.
cont.entity_b: Wireless device does not work with PS/2 KVM switch.

cont.entity_a: Mouse has a nice heft. Great range and durability.
Not compatible with older versions of Logitech cordless mouse.
Software installation can be clunky. Shortcut keys and features require installation of bundled software.
cont.entity_b: Setup and installation are easy. Bluetooth dongle issues with Windows recognition.

cont.entity_a: Battery life notification is useful. Mouse batteries are rechargeable and come with a charger. Mouse batteries last 2-4 weeks on a single charge.
cont.entity_b: Mouse and number pad have power switches to conserve battery life. MediaPad consumes batteries quickly with no off option.

cont.entity_a: Scroll wheel issues due to driver problems, improved with new driver.

Keyboard.comm: Keyboard has a great key touch.

cont.entity_a: Keyboard has a tight action. Keyboard buttons are shrunk, not ideal for people with disabilities. Keyboard can be positioned almost anywhere. Great keyboard feel and functionality. Keys on the keyboard have a nice tactile feel. Keyboard feels great with many functional keys. Keyboard is USB.
cont.entity_b: Detachable keypad provides more workspace. Keys feel great, but '000' next to '0' on keypad can be confusing. Keyboard is trim and solid with a nice feel. Spacebar sticks badly on the keyboard. No option to elevate the keypad.

cont.entity_a: Mouse is big, clumpy, and has terrible movement. Mouse is ergonomic but a bit heavy. Mouse works perfectly and has good battery life. Mouse on the combo is uncomfortable. Mouse has a short range of about 3 feet. Mouse battery pack was defective, customer service issues with Amazon.
cont.entity_b: Mouse feels small for some users. Mouse feels light and shabby. Mouse works well on various surfaces.

cont.entity_a: Software adds functionality to multimedia controls. Media controls can be programmed using the software.
cont.entity_b: Separate calculator is a nice feature. Num pad doubles as a calculator with clock and temperature readout.
Logitech customer service is US-based and helpful.

cont.entity_a: Occasional lag or interference can occur if mouse base is too close to computer and speakers. Occasional need to reinstall driver on reboot.
cont.entity_b: Problem with number pad causing random inputs.
